meanings.definition: A regulation requiring people to remain indoors between specified hours, typically at night.
meanings.sent1: During the pandemic, many cities imposed strict curfews to limit the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent2: The mayor announced that the curfews would start at 10 PM every night.
meanings.sent3: When the clock struck midnight, Sarah's cat meowed loudly, reminding her of the curfews.
meanings.sent4: The curfews hung over the city like a heavy blanket, forcing everyone to retreat to their homes.
meanings.sent5: The image of the police cars patrolling the empty streets during curfews was etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: The time by which people must be off the streets or at home.
meanings.sent1: As the curfews approached, families hurried back to their houses, eager to avoid any trouble.
meanings.sent2: The curfews in the town were set at 9 PM to ensure safety for all residents.
meanings.sent3: During the curfews, the streets were eerily quiet, with only the sound of distant sirens breaking the silence.
meanings.sent4: Under the cover of darkness, the curfews acted as a shield, protecting the citizens from potential dangers.
meanings.sent5: The strict curfews made it challenging for night owls to enjoy their usual late-night activities.
